H0.text: Which French chemist produced the first vaccine against Anthrax. Antoine Lavoisier

H1.text: Which French chemist produced the first vaccine against Anthrax. Claude Louis Berthollet

H2.text: Which French chemist produced the first vaccine against Anthrax. Joseph Gay-Lussac

H3.text: Which French chemist produced the first vaccine against Anthrax. Pasteur

A4.text: Henry Toussaint developed the first vaccine.

A5.text: Pasteur's vaccine at Pouilly-le-Fort was a potassium dichromate-killed vaccine, not a live vaccine as he claimed.

A6.text: Pasteur used the method of rival Jean-Joseph-Henri Toussaint (1847–1890), a Toulouse veterinary surgeon, to create the anthrax vaccine.

A7.text: Louis Pasteur applied his previous method of immunising chickens against chicken cholera to anthrax, which affected cattle, and thereby aroused widespread interest in combating other diseases with the same approach.

A8.text: Pasteur used the method of rival Jean-Joseph-Henri Toussaint (1847–1890) to create the anthrax vaccine.
